Detailed Description

License file.

This class acts as both a license checker and license file. To run CMLIB you need to have an active CMLicense.php file. When you renew your license you will receive a new CMLicense.php that will replace the existing one. You do not have to restart your server or any services (eg Apache) for the new license to take effect.

You may view your current license and PHP information by using the phpinfo.php file provided with the package.

Author:
Elliot Chance

Member Function Documentation

static CheckLicense (  )  [static]

Check if the license is valid for this machine.

If your licence is missing, invalid, altered or expired you will not be able to use the CMLIB software until it is renewed. Chance MEDIA recommends renewal of licenses 30 days before they expire.

Returns:
Nothing.

Definition at line 78 of file CMLicense.php.

static GetSalt (  )  [static]

Get the salt for this machine.

Returns:
The salt returned will be used to bind the license to this machine.

Definition at line 47 of file CMLicense.php.

static GetStatus (  )  [static]

Get license status.

For Invalid or Expired, please contact Chance MEDIA Pty Ltd for license repair or renewal.

Returns:
Either "Invalid", "Active" or "Expired".
